question: Lucas has 40 square yards of kiwi field. There are 96 kiwis per square yard. Lucas can harvest his kiwis every 6 months. How many kiwis can Lucas harvest within a year?
answer:
Lucas has 96*40= <<96*40=3840>>3840 kiwis on his field.
Lucas can harvest his kiwis 12 / 6 = <<12/6=2>>2 times per year
Therefore Lucas can harvest 3840*2 = <<3840*2=7680>>7680 kiwis per year.
#### 7680
